official-title.#text:
To promote timely exploration for geothermal resources
		  under existing geothermal leases, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Exploring for Geothermal Energy on
			 Federal Lands Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for
			 the development and production of geothermal resources, that—

term.#tail:
means the drilling of a well to test or explore
			 for geothermal resources on lands leased by the

text.#text: In this section the term

header.#text:
Definition of
			 geothermal exploration test project

text.#text:
is carried out by
			 the holder of the lease;
causes—

less than 5 acres
			 of soil or vegetation disruption at the location of each geothermal exploration
			 well; and

is

no deeper than
			 2,500 feet;

less than 8 inches
			 in diameter;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Exploring for Geothermal Energy on Federal Lands Act/s:2/ss:c

text.#text:
in a manner that
			 does not require off-road motorized access other than to and from the well site
			 along an identified off-road route for which notice is provided to the

without
			 construction of new roads other than upgrading of existing drainage crossings
			 for safety purposes; and

with the use of
			 rubber-tired digging or drilling equipment vehicles;

is completed in
			 less than 45 days, including the removal of any surface infrastructure from the
			 site; and

requires the
			 restoration of the project site within 3 years to approximately the condition
			 that existed at the time the project began, unless the site is subsequently
			 used as part of energy development on the lease.

			 project.
